newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Lumonics sees 20-25 percent Asian growth.
newsitem.headline: Lumonics sees 20-25 percent Asian growth.

text.p: Canadian-based Lumonics Inc expects its Asia-Pacific revenues to grow by 20-25 percent in 1997, Patrick Austin, vice president of worldwide sales, said on Friday.
Austin, in Singapore for the opening of Lumonics Asia- Pacific regional sales and service centre, said regional revenues rose 27 percent in 1996 to Singapore $32 million.
"We have an internal projection of about 20-25 percent this year. Asia Pacific is the fastest growing area for us," Austin told Reuters.
The Canadian company specialises in the development, production and support of lasers and laser-based systems.
Austin said Asia-Pacific sales, excluding Japan, currently contributed about 15 percent of group revenues, which was about Canadian $209 million in 1996.

He also said that while the group's main emphasis in the region had been heavily focused on the semiconductor and electronics industry, there were plans to step up activity in the aerospace and automobile industries.
